definition: ambush/to ambush
surname Fu
to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt
to hit/to strike/to break/Taiwan pr. [ji2]

sentences.english: Thus attacked, the Japanese would be afraid to split up.
sentences.chinese: 一遭到這樣的伏擊，日軍就龜縮作一因。

sentences.english: Person's dead bodies that ambuscade us are entire secondhand along them to turn corpse powder to turn work to.
sentences.chinese: 伏擊我們的人屍首都被他們用化屍粉化去了。

sentences.english: General Yanbei detachment of the Japanese army first ambush Guang-wu, avoid enemy more than 500 people.
sentences.chinese: 將軍之雁北支隊首戰伏擊廣武日軍，毖敵500餘人。

sentences.english: Boss: So the Cobras could ambush him.
sentences.chinese: 這樣眼鏡蛇才能伏擊他。

sentences.english: Sure enough, Xiao Hui were ambushed on the way.
sentences.chinese: 果不其然，蕭輝在路上遭到伏擊。

sentences.english: The policemen were from the southern Shi'ite city of Najaf.
sentences.chinese: 遭到伏擊的警察來自南部什葉派城市納傑夫。

sentences.english: Mutilate, Backstab, Garrote and Ambush can no longer be dodged.
sentences.chinese: 毀傷，背刺，鑿，伏擊不再能被躲閃。

sentences.english: Jack escapes to Italy after the opening ambush in Sweden.
sentences.chinese: 在瑞典的露天伏擊之後，傑克逃亡到了意大利。

sentences.english: Acrossan open field, they could see the spot where they had been ambushed two daysbefore.
sentences.chinese: 穿過一片空地，他們可以看到兩天前遭遇伏擊的地點。

sentences.english: Claudius organization staff successfully ambushed Bai Dayis team.
sentences.chinese: 革老組織人手成功地伏擊了白大怡所在的車隊。

sentences.english: The units launch ambushes, order airstrikes and conduct night raids.
sentences.chinese: 這些軍隊發起伏擊，下令空襲，及指揮夜間突襲。

sentences.english: The Elves of Silvermoon are ambushed on the plains of Alterac.
sentences.chinese: 銀月城的高精靈在奧特蘭克平原被伏擊。

sentences.english: Mr. Zhao looked anguished at being ambushed by his friend.
sentences.chinese: 被朋友伏擊，趙亮看上去很痛苦。

sentences.english: En route, they were ambushed by Tusken Raiders.
sentences.chinese: 在途中，他們遭到塔斯肯襲擊者的伏擊。

definition: to prepare an ambush/to waylay
the few are no match for the many/heavily outnumbered/facing impossible odds (idiom)
to apprehend/to capture/to seize
to fish by casting a net/to capture/to surround and seize
to shoot with a gun/shooting incident
to hunt and kill (an animal or fish)
to mount a sneak attack/to raid
to gang up and beat
to attack with a bladed weapon
thief
night attack
to hold under duress
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
to shoot dead (with a gun, or bow and arrow)
to make an amphibious assault/to seize a beachhead/to gain a foothold in (a new market)
to injure/to wound/to damage
